org.gearvrf

Class GVRShaderTemplate

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRShaderTemplate
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ColorShader, GVRDepthShader, GVRPhongShader, YuvNv21ToRgbShader

    public class GVRShaderTemplate
extends java.lang.Object
    Generates a set of vertex and fragment shaders from the same source template. Each shader template keeps a set of named source code segments which are used to compose the shaders. The code in the "FragmentTemplate" slot is the master template for the fragment shader, the one attached as "VertexTemplate" is the master for the vertex shader. Any name in the fragment template that starts with "@Fragment" is replaced by the shader segment attached in that slot. Similarly, names in the vertex template that start with "@Vertex" are replaced with vertex shader segments. This permits multiple segments to be combined into a single fragment or vertex shader. The segment names are also #defined in the shader for conditional compilation. To generate different variants from the same source we use #ifdef creatively. Any shader variable name starting with a "HAS_" is assumed to be a #ifdef that affects the generated code. These names typically correspond to uniforms, textures or vertex buffer attributes. If these parameters are defined by the material or mesh, that name will be #defined to 1 in the shader. Otherwise, it will not be defined. Each shader variant generated has a unique signature so that the same variant will not be generated twice. The shader template also defines a uniform descriptor which contains the names and types of all the uniforms in the material used by the shader. Each entry is a float or integer type, an optional count and the name of the uniform (e.g. "float3 diffuse_color, float specular_exponent, int is_enabled" Multiple lights are supported by specifying light shader source code segments in GVRLightBase. You can define different light implementations with their own data structures and these will be included in the generated fragment shader.
    See Also:
    GVRPhongShader, GVRLightBase

    • Constructor Detail

      • GVRShaderTemplate

        public GVRShaderTemplate(java.lang.String descriptor)
        Construct a shader template for a shader using GLSL version 100. To make a shader for another version use the other form of the constructor.
        Parameters:
        descriptor - string describing uniform names and types

      • GVRShaderTemplate

        public GVRShaderTemplate(java.lang.String descriptor,
                         int glslVersion)
        Construct a shader template
        Parameters:
        descriptor - string describing uniform names and types
        glslVersion - integer giving GLSL version (e.g. 300)

    • Method Detail

      • getSegment

        public java.lang.String getSegment(java.lang.String name)
        Get the designated shader segment.
        Parameters:
        name - string name of shader segment
        Returns:
        source code for segment or null if none exists. getSegment(String) setSegment}

      • setSegment

        public void setSegment(java.lang.String segmentName,
                       java.lang.String shaderSource)
        Attach a named shader segment. Shader segment names should start with either "Vertex" or "Fragment" to designate which type of shader the code belongs with. Both vertex and fragment shaders can have more than one code segment contribute to the final shader.
        Parameters:
        segmentName - name associated with shader segment
        shaderSource - String with shader source code

      • getUniformDescriptor

        public java.lang.String getUniformDescriptor()
        Get the string describing the shader uniforms. Each uniform is a fixed number of integer or float values. It is described with the type ("int" or "float") immediately followed by the size (a small integer) a space and then the name of uniform in the shader (e.g. "int enabled, float3 color") Spaces, commas, and other punctuation are ignored.
        Returns:
        String with descriptor. GVRLightBase.getUniformDescriptor() getUniformDescriptor }

      • generateSignature

        public java.lang.String generateSignature(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> defined,
                                          GVRLightBase[] lightlist)
        Create a unique signature for this shader variant.
        Parameters:
        defined - names to be defined for this shader
        lightlist - list of lights used with this shader
        Returns:
        string signature for shader

      • bindShader

        public void bindShader(GVRContext context,
                       GVRRenderData rdata,
                       GVRScene scene)
        Select the specific vertex and fragment shader to use. The shader template is used to generate the sources for the vertex and fragment shader based on the vertex, material and light properties. This function may compile the shader if it does not already exist.
        Parameters:
        context - GVRContext
        rdata - GVRRenderData with mesh and material to use
        scene - scene being rendered

      • bindShader

        public void bindShader(GVRContext context,
                       GVRMaterial material)
        Select the specific vertex and fragment shader to use with this material. The shader template is used to generate the sources for the vertex and fragment shader based on the material properties only. It will ignore the mesh attributes and all lights.
        Parameters:
        context - GVRContext
        material - material to use with the shader

      • bindShader

        public void bindShader(GVRContext context,
                       GVRPostEffect material)
        Select the specific vertex and fragment shader to use for this post effect. The shader template is used to generate the sources for the vertex and fragment shader based on the material properties only. It will ignore the mesh attributes and all lights.
        Parameters:
        context - GVRContext
        material - material to use with the shader

      • getRenderDefines

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> getRenderDefines(GVRRenderData rdata,
                                                                              GVRScene scene)
        Generate shader-specific defines from the rendering information. You can override this function in your shader class to change which variant is generated depending on the GVRRenderData settings. The base implementation LIGHTSOURCES as 0 if lighting is not enabled by the render data, and it defines SHADOWS as 1 if any light source enables shadow casting.
        Parameters:
        rdata - GVRRenderData being used by this shader
        scene - scene being rendered
        Returns:
        list of symbols to be defined (value 1) or undefined (value 0) in the shader
        See Also:
        setCastShadow

      • makeMaterialMap

        protected void makeMaterialMap(GVRShaders material,
                               GVRShaderMaps map)
        Makes the material map for the shader. The material map does not change any names, just maps the keys in the material to themselves.
        Parameters:
        material - material to make map for
        map - material map to populate
